items: Stand or sit with good posture, keeping your spine straight.
Place your hands on the back of your head, interlacing your fingers.
Gently pull your head down towards your chest, using your hands to provide a slight resistance.
Hold the stretch for 15-30 seconds, feeling a gentle stretch in the back of your neck.
Slowly release the stretch and return to your starting position.
Repeat the stretch 2-3 times, as needed.
Relieves tension and pain in the neck and upper back
Improves posture by strengthening the neck muscles
Increases range of motion in the neck
Reduces the risk of neck injuries
Can be done anywhere without any equipment
